channel.title: BBC News | England | UK Edition
channel.description: Get the latest BBC England news: breaking news, in-depth features, analysis and debate plus audio and video coverage from the English regions.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse

item.title: Ex-MI6 man admits secrecy breach
item.description: A former MI6 worker says he was "directed by voices" after admitting charges of unlawfully disclosing top secret material.

item.title: Tests on flats fire arrest woman
item.description: A woman arrested after a tower block fire in south-west London is undergoing psychiatric assessment after being bailed.

item.title: Wave Hub project 'is going ahead'
item.description: The £42m alternative energy Wave Hub project off the coast of Cornwall is to go ahead despite cuts, it is announced.

item.title: Gunman Moat 'should be in jail'
item.description: The sister of the woman shot by gunman Raoul Moat says she wishes he was still alive so he could be brought to justice.

item.title: Cars catch fire close to palaces
item.description: Emergency services are called to car fires a short distance from Buckingham Palace and Clarence House.

item.title: Council's care of baby criticised
item.description: Social services in Manchester are criticised in a review into the care given to a baby boy who was blinded and suffered brain damage.

item.title: Six held over human trafficking
item.description: Kent Police arrest six men in a series of raids across Britain as part of a human trafficking investigation.

item.title: 'Amazing' recovery for fox plucked from the sea
item.description: A young fox found floating in the sea off Eastbourne is pulled from the water to make an "amazing" recovery.

item.title: Memorial to Titanic victim could be restored for centenary
item.description: A bid to revamp a memorial in Godalming for Jack Phillips, chief telegraphist on the Titanic, moves forward.

item.title: Cup flops England climb rankings
item.description: England rise one place to seventh in Fifa's world rankings, despite an early World Cup exit, while Spain replace Brazil at number one.

item.title: Redknapp signs Tottenham deal
item.description: Tottenham boss Harry Redknapp extends his contract with the club until 2013 after leading them to fourth place in the Premier League last season.

item.title: Bolt veto leads to tax tweak call
item.description: UK Athletics calls for changes to British tax laws after Usain Bolt pulls out of a London appearance on financial grounds.

item.title: Bird's eye view
item.description: Tower block residents watch 2012 site progress

item.title: Back to normal
item.description: Wounded soldier finds new job in museum

item.title: Acts of Mercy
item.description: The art that greeted hospital visitors

item.title: What's it worth?
item.description: Is £200,000 too much for a head teacher?

item.title: Cumbria tragedy
item.description: Harlequins captain nearly quit over brother's death

item.title: BBC Local
item.description: Find out about your community from bbc.co.uk

item.title: Man denies grandmother murder
item.description: A man accused of murdering his grandmother in north London is remanded in custody after pleading not guilty.

item.title: Man critical after shop stabbing
item.description: A man is said to be in a critical condition in hospital after suffering a stab wound in a Birmingham shop.

item.title: Service held for killed firemen
item.description: A memorial service is held for two firefighters who died in a flat fire in Southampton.

item.title: Hospital criticised over Baby P
item.description: Great Ormond Street Hospital did not disclose key information to the original inquiry into what happened to Baby Peter, it is claimed.

item.title: 'Molasses' poured in BP protest
item.description: An oil-like substance is poured around one of the British Museum's statues by activists urging it to stop its sponsorship by BP.

item.title: Injured pedestrian gets damages
item.description: A pedestrian injured in a road accident wins the right to compensation from a council which failed to trim bushes on a central reservation.

item.title: Four bailed over India murder
item.description: Four men arrested in the West Midlands over a high profile murder in India are released on bail.

item.title: Ten rescued after fire at flats
item.description: Ten people are rescued from flats in Staplehurst, Kent, after a fire breaks out on the first floor.

item.title: Turbine business boost hopes
item.description: Plans for thousands of wind turbines in the North Sea bring hopes of 700 jobs at a new plant in Norfolk or Suffolk.

item.title: Balls claims children 'let down'
item.description: The Shadow Education Secretary says Black Country children have been let down after rebuilding projects were scrapped.

item.title: New cement mixer death probe
item.description: Essex Police says it will reinvestigate the death of a man whose body was found in a cement mixer lorry eight years ago.

item.title: Heart transplant patients reunite
item.description: Four people who had heart transplant operations in the same week 20 years ago are reunited at a Cambridgeshire hospital.

item.title: Canal closure plan due to drought
item.description: Nearly half of the Leeds and Liverpool Canal could close as the North West struggles with its worst drought since 1929.

item.title: Murder inquiry after flat attack
item.description: Detectives in Liverpool have begun a murder inquiry after a man dies in hospital following an attack in a flat.

item.title: Children found with dead mother
item.description: Two young sisters taken into care after spending two days trapped in a house with their dead mother are "doing well".

item.title: Consortium pulls out of Corus bid
item.description: A consortium pulls out of bid to save the partially mothballed Corus steel plant in Redcar.

item.title: Hotel fire 'may have been arson'
item.description: A fire which forced the evacuation of a Blackpool hotel may have been started deliberately, the fire service says.

item.title: Cycle ride celebrates life of boy
item.description: About 200 people joined a bike ride through Leeds to celebrate the life of a talented teenage cyclist who died in his sleep.

item.title: Pub CCTV appeal over fatal attack
item.description: A potential witness to a fatal attack in Wiltshire is being asked to contact the police.

item.title: Swarms keep city beekeeper busy
item.description: A Plymouth beekeeper is running out of hive space for the numerous swarms he has been asked to collect this summer.

item.title: Dead diver ex-Royal Navy man
item.description: A diver who died in hospital after getting into difficulties off the Dorset coast is identified as a former member of the Royal Navy.

item.title: Gas plant planning appeal begins
item.description: A public inquiry begins into controversial plans for a gas pressure reduction installation at Tirley in Gloucestershire.

item.title: Probe looks into water park death
item.description: Police and health and safety officials begin an inquiry into an accident at a water park after which a 15-year-old girl died.

item.title: Policeman held over drugs in pub
item.description: A serving officer with Devon and Cornwall Police is arrested on suspicion of possessing drugs at a Torquay pub.
